result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (2nd) and Operating w/ PAC (3rd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (2nd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (3rd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Bert John Quinn was found guilty of OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Bond money, if any, shall be applied to restitution, attorney fees, fines and costs, or any other financial obligation ordered by this court.  If bond posted exceeds the aforementioned, it shall be refunded to the poster unless other arrangements have been made with the court.

Defendant shall contact the Iron County Sheriff's Department at (715) 561-2440 within 10 business days of sentencing to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample.  Defendant shall also pay the surcharge for same.

5 days is imposed and 5 days is stayed pending completion of 40 hours of community service within 60 days.  Defendant is eligible for Good Time and Huber at the discretion of the Iron County Sheriff's policies.
Defendant shall participate in AODA and any follow through.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Bert John Quinn in court with attorney M. Joseph Rafferty.  Matthew J Tingstad appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA calls case at 10:29 a.m.  Cites appearances.  Plea agreement reached.  DA makes motion to amend Count #2 to OWI2nd and dismiss Counts 1 and 3.  Also makes motion to dismiss 16tr636 and 16TR665.  Court grants motions.  Attorney Rafferty states agreement for Court.  Def agrees as stated.  No  coercion.  PLQ filed.  Def admits signing without coercion.  Court questions Atty Rafferty re: plea-Def pleads guilty.  Def agrees.  Atty Rafferty is satisfied def freely, knowingly and intelligently pleads.  Court accepts plea, finds def guilty and follows agreement.  Sentences to 10 days ICJ with Good Time.  5 days imposed and 5 days stayed pending completion of 40 hours of community service.  Def has 60 days to report or do CS.  $1429 with 60 DTP, AODA and follow through, 12 month license revocation and 12 month IID.  Previous motions to dismiss various counts already granted.  DNA sample to be provided.  Surcharge included in assessment.  Def also received 1 day credit for time served.  Adjourned at 10:36 a.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 5, 2017 at 10:30 am.

Jury trial on December 5, 2017 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Bert John Quinn in court with attorney M. Joseph Rafferty.  Matthew J Tingstad appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA calls case at 10:27 a.m.  DA explains has witness who will be appearing at trial but can only appear via video.  Court determines it can be facilitated.  Atty Rafferty objects and states statute.  DA asks court for adjournment of trial so witness can appear in person.  No objections from defense.  Court grants objection of atty Rafferty and also grants adjournment of trial.  To be set as soon as DA can have witness available in person.  Bond to continue.  ADjourned at 10:31 a.m.  klr

11:09:  Defendant Bert John Quinn in court.  Martin J. Lipske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA calls case.  Cites appearances.  Attorney Sam Filippo is appointed by court per defendant's petition for court appointment but not available.  Court to enter NG pleas on defendant's behalf and schedule for PTC with attorney Filippo.  Complaint is served on defendant.  Court preserves all of defendants protections to challenge any issues.  klr

Defendant Bert John Quinn in court, in custody.  Frederick j Schellgell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA calls case.  Public defender info given to def.  OWI 3rd possible charge.  Right to counsel explained.  Court sets $1,000 signature bond with conditions of no alcohol, no taverns, no liquor stores, no controlled substances.  Initial to be scheduled for 8/15/16 at 10:30 a.m.  klr
NO ALCOHOL, NO TAVERNS, NO LIQUOR STORES, NO CONTROLLED SUBSTANCES.
